skillTree.localised_description: Marauder mobs are awarded even greater mobility when riding their crude chariots of bone and wood, lashed together with the guts and sinew of the vanquished.

attributes.bullet_text:
A unit with the Mark of Khorne has:
	➕ Frenzy Passive Ability
	➕ Increased  Spell Resistance
	➕ Increased  Armour
	➖ Reduced  Melee Defence
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

skillTree.localised_description: Mighty beasts of groaning iron and brass, taller than a man and possessed of a crushing mass.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
What magic can penetrate the searing hatred within the minds of the Blood God's most brutal followers.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

skillTree.localised_description: "We will slaughter them all, and laugh as they beg for mercy. It will be a good day."
The Great Hound of War thirsts eternally for blood and slaughter, its rage manifesting itself in the unstoppable martial spirit of its warriors.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Styrbjorn's ascension to the throne saw his clan grow in power and influence, his daring leadership and peerless battle skill bringing victory on countless raids staged against the traditional foes of the tribe.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Strovengaard's wolves will follow its Jarl, defending his person with great savagery and scant regard for their own lives.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Horrible Regeneration" for Skin Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Skin Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skin Wolves units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Only a foolish hunter returns to the same hunting ground every day. A wise hunter varies his hunts, so as not to hunt any one of his prey-flocks to extinction."

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +30% after winning a battle
Campaign movement range: +30% after razing a settlement

skillTree.localised_description: Styrbjorn's army is usually largely assembled from his loyal berserker warriors, also known as Savages, they are a brutal sect of Northmen warriors, known chiefly for being subject to terrifying battle-frenzies.

Styrbjorn has slain tens of thousands of foes in battle, and has amply demonstrated the favour of his god Khorne by doing so. The Jarl's naturally prodigious strength is further augmented by an unnatural constitution, as the blessings of his god has made him capable to shrug off even the most terrible of blows with ease.
"My Master is the Beginning and he is the End. He is the Master of mortals, and the core of our Dead Hearts. Deny him and you deny yourselves. Honour him, and acknowledge he to whom we owe it all."

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -50% for Chaos Warriors, Chosen, and Chaos Knights of Khorne units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
Blink and you die.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who do not bend the knee to the Gods of the North soon find all they hold dear obliterated before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Delighting in death and suffering, these savage warriors follow their ignoble Lord wherever he goes.

skillTree.localised_description: Only the fiercest creatures can survive the frozen north; the strongest are rounded up for war and starved into viciousness, ready for the next battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold cuts into the flesh, burning the foe's extremities until they drop off altogether!

skillTree.localised_description: The razor-sharp hail of the north is not the only danger in the Norscan sky – its airborne beasts are just as deadly and far less predictable.

skillTree.localised_description: Giant, deadly, and able to take orders, this Lord’s monstrosities are especially terrifying and lethal.

skillTree.localised_description: The legions march forth under the Lord's inscrutable gaze, eager to kill for fear of his wrath.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The worthiest of Chaos' vanguard are blessed with the most elaborate mutations, which also enable them to move faster for longer.

skillTree.localised_description: The intense cold and near-constant darkness of the far north make for a certain kind of killer.

skillTree.localised_description: The freezing darkness and stunning violence of the far north bring no small solace to those who have lost everything and wish to forget.

skillTree.localised_description: There is no other choice. There never was.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
That which is not offered up to the Dark Gods of the North in tribute is harvested by their servants for their own petty gain.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
Maybe it is the influence of the Dark Gods that has caused the populace to burgeon and proliferate beyond their natural bounds?
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

effects.description:
Attrition suffered by defender: +5% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +10% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: There's something about the harsh, unforgiving nature of northern life that makes its occupants fight harder and longer than many of their soft, southern equivalents.
The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +150
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: War and glory before the Gods are the determining elements in every decision made; there is nothing else worth living - or dying - for.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

factionEffects.localised_description: "The lord of skulls shall feast on your heart and drink of your blood, woman. And know, that in the times of Darkness that will soon come to engulf the world, the gods themselves will walk the land, leading their legions in the battle to end all battles. And in those End Times, Great Kharnath will cut down your Lady, hacking her head from her shoulders and great shall be the lamentation. Your goddess shall perish -- she knows this. And now, you too know the truth."

effects.description: Marauder Chieftains may devote themselves to Khorne, becoming powerful Chaos Lords of Khorne
Has access to various Khorne mortal units
Immune to High Seas, Reef and Storm attrition

Leadership aura size: +50% when at sea
	(all characters)
Full Speed stance is upgraded to "Flank Speed stance" which increases campaign map navigation range and line of sight while at sea

items.colour_text: His naturally prodigious strength is further augmented by an unnatural constitution, as the blessings of his god has made him capable to shrug off even the most terrible of blows with ease.

ui_effects.localised_text: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

items.colour_text: The twin hellforged battle-axes of the High Jarl of Strovengaard; ancient daemon weapons forged in the realms beyond flesh in honour of the bloody wolves said to accompany Khorne the Blood God on his wild hunts across the heavens, which drive the sun to cower and flee before the god's fury, creating the alternation of night and day in Norscan mythology.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Egil Styrbjorn, known also as the Slayer of Souls and the Butcher of Immortals is a Norscan High Jarl of Skaeling, and one of the greatest champions of the Blood God Khorne to ever walk the land.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

Weapon strength: +1% per enemy faction leader killed
	(Lord's army)

A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.
